info.name: csw
info.description:
Common Software is the package of services and infrastructure software that integrates the TMT software systems.

http://www.tmt.org

This collection of routes consists of http end points exposed by TMT common software.

Complete codebase is available at https://github.com/tmtsoftware/csw-prod

item.name: Configuration Service

query.description: Flag to upload file in Annex store.
Create commit message.

request.description:
Create Api lets you upload configuration file in the repository.
Configuraion file gets stored in annex store if one of the below condition statisfies else gets stored in normal store :
1. Annex flag is true
2. File size exceeds the maximum size configured in Configuration service.

query.description: Flag to upload file in Annex store.
Create commit message.
Flag to upload file in Annex store.
Create commit message.
Revision number of configuration file.
Latest version of file on provided timestamp will be retrieved.

request.description: Get Api fetches the latest version of requested configuration file from the repository either from normal/annex store.

query.description: Update commit message.

request.description: Update Api modifies the content of existing file with the updated content.
Delete Api removes the configuration file from repository.

query.description: One of Annex/Normal File type.
Regular expression to filter list of files.

request.description: List Api returns the path of all the configuration files available in annex/normal store.

query.description: Fetch the provided number of results,
Retrieves history from timestamp onwards.
Retrieves hostory till the timestamp.

request.description: History Api retrieves id, comment and timestamp of all the revisons of configuration files.

query.description: Fetch the provided number of results,
Retrieves active revisions history from timestamp onwards.
Retrieves active revisions history till the provided timestamp.

request.description: History-Active Api retrieves id, comment and timestamp of only active revisons of configuration files.

query.description: Revision number of configuration file to be marked as active.
Set active commit message.

request.description: Set Active version Api sets the provided id as a active revision of configuration file.

query.description: Reset active commit message.

request.description: Reset active version api, sets the current active version of file to the master (latest version of file).
Get active version Api fetches the current active version of a configuration file.

query.description: Fetch the active configuration file on provided timestamp.

request.description: Get active Api retrieves the current active configuration file. If date query parameter is provided, active configuration file on provided timestamp gets retrieved.

Performing a simple `GET` request to this endpoint returns status code `401 Unauthorized` with `WWW-Authenticate` header containing information to successfully authenticate subsequent requests.
The `WWW-Authenticate` header must be processed to extract `realm` and `nonce` values to hash subsequent requests.

When this request is executed within Postman, the script attached with this request does the hard work of extracting realm and nonce from the header and set it as [global variables](https://www.getpostman.com/docs/environments#global-variables?source=echo-collection-app-onboarding) named `echo_digest_nonce` and `echo_digest_realm`.
These variables are re-used in subsequent request for seamless integration of the two requests.

Get metadata Api returns the following configurations of Configuration service :
1. Repository Path
2. Annex store Path
3. Annex file min Size
4. Max Config File Size

item.description: Configuration service provides the collection of api's to store, retrieve and maintain the history of component configuration files.

item.name: Log Admin

request.description:
Get log metatdata Api returns the current log level details for particular component. Response contains below details :
1. LogLevel
2. PekkoLevel
3. Slf4jLevel
4. ComponentLevel

query.description: Log level, can be one of TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL.

request.description: Set log level Api dynamically changes the log level of component.
Set log level Api dynamically changes the log level of component.
Set log level Api dynamically changes the log level of component.
Set log level Api dynamically changes the log level of component.

item.description: Log admin provides Api to fetch the current log configurations and alter if required.
